description: Primes p such that p-2 is not a prime.
comments: Primes p (for p>=11) such that sigma(p-2) > p. - _Benoit Cloitre_, Feb 08 2002Prime numbers that are not the sum of two smaller prime numbers. - _Tomas Xordan_, May 10 2007
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) ~ n log n. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jan 10 2013
mathematica: Select[ Prime /@ Range[100], ! PrimeQ[# - 2] &] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Apr 19 2013 *)
prog: (MAGMA) [p: p in PrimesUpTo(420) | not IsPrime(p-2)]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jul 26 2013(PARI) lista(nn) = forprime(p=2, nn, if (!isprime(p-2), print1(p, ", "));); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Dec 05 2015
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
